intro: Pleuroridgea bussei, commonly known as the African violet, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight. Its foliage is typically velvety and dark green, with a distinctive ridge-like pattern on the leaves. Pleuroridgea bussei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
